questions.answer_description:
Dual-homed or dual-homing can refer to either an Ethernet device that has more than one network interface, for redundancy purposes, or in firewall technology, dual-homed is one of the firewall architectures, such as an IDS/IPS system, for implementing preventive security.
References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dual-homed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. They must be dual-homed. Dual-homed configurations allow IDS/IPS systems or proxy servers to handle network traffic more securely and efficiently by having separate network interfaces for different network segments.
I agree with you guys

comments.content: Did you pass the exam? Did you buy contributor access of this exam or used the free version?

discussion.content: Hi guys don't waste your time, I have just done the exam and none of the questions from here were present. not one. your choice time and money gl all
Answer B
An IDS is not the same as IPS. IDS need not be dual homed. An IPS can be inline or non-inline and can work with one physical ethernet connection.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a hardware requirement that either an IDS/IPS system or a proxy server must have in order to properly function?
Which of the following is an application that requires a host application for replication?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Virus. A virus requires a host application to replicate and spread by attaching itself to executable files or documents.
Answer D
d: VIRUS

D
Computer viruses infect a variety of different subsystems on their hosts. A computer virus is a malware that, when executed, replicates by reproducing it self or infecting other programs by modifying them. Infecting computer programs can include as well, data files, or the boot sector of the hard drive. When this replication succeeds, the affected areas are then said to be "infected".
References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_virus

Answer B

BBProxy.

questions.question_text: A large company intends to use Blackberry for corporate mobile phones and a security analyst is assigned to evaluate the possible threats. The analyst will use the Blackjacking attack method to demonstrate how an attacker could circumvent perimeter defenses and gain access to the corporate network. What tool should the analyst use to perform a Blackjacking attack?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Perform a full restore. To ensure that a tape backup can be recovered in its entirety, performing a full restore verifies that all data on the tape can be successfully recovered.
B: A full restore is required.

Answer B
A full restore is required.

questions.question_text: Which of the following can the administrator do to verify that a tape backup can be recovered in its entirety?

choices.C: Read the first 512 bytes of the tape.
choices.D: Read the last 512 bytes of the tape.

questions.question_text: Which of the following describes the characteristics of a Boot Sector Virus?

choices.B: Moves the MBR to another location on the hard disk and copies itself to the original location of the MBR
choices.C: Modifies directory table entries so that directory entries point to the virus code instead of the actual program
choices.A: Moves the MBR to another location on the RAM and copies itself to the original location of the MBR
choices.D: Overwrites the original MBR and only executes the new virus code

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
CEHv12 Pg1033 - A boot sector virus moves MBR to another location on the hard disk and copies itself to the original location of MBR. When the system boots, first, the virus code executes and then control passes to the original MBR.

Answer B
A boot sector virus is a computer virus that infects a storage device's master boot record (MBR). The virus moves the boot sector to another location on the hard drive.
References: https://www.techopedia.com/definition/26655/boot-sector-virus

A boot sector virus moves MBR to another location on the hard disk and copies itself to the original location of MBR. When the system boots, first, the virus code executes and then control passes to the original MBR
